importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: A call from a fake Defence Minister Guido Crosetto was reported on this date, prompting the real minister to investigate and publicly respond.
Defence Minister Guido Crosetto posted on X about receiving a call from a 'friend' who claimed to have been contacted by his office, revealing the scam.
The research by Queen Mary University of London on AI voice realism was published in PLOS One on this date.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: A sharp increase in global deepfake scams was reported between January and June 2025, with losses exceeding $547.2 million.

keyTakeAways: AI-generated voices have become indistinguishable from real human voices, especially when cloned from real individuals.
Fake calls impersonating Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto targeted wealthy businessmen, including Giorgio Armani and Patrizio Bertelli, asking for money.
Only Massimo Moratti, former Inter Milan owner, actually transferred funds, which were later frozen by police.
Research by Queen Mary University of London shows that 41% of AI-generated voices and 58% of voice clones were mistaken for real voices.
Participants rated AI-generated voices as more trustworthy than real human voices, indicating a significant trust gap.
AI voice cloning is now used in scams, with rising global losses due to deepfake fraud.
AI deepfakes are being used to create fake videos and sexually explicit content, including child sexual abuse material, raising serious ethical and legal concerns.
Legal responses include US President Donald Trump’s 2025 bill criminalizing the publication of AI-generated intimate images, and Australia banning an app used for generating deepfake nudity.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A series of deepfake voice scams targeted wealthy Italian businessmen in early 2025, with fraudsters using AI to mimic the voice of Defence Minister Guido Crosetto to request money for a fictional rescue of kidnapped journalists. The scam, which occurred shortly after Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni secured the release of journalist Cecilia Sala from Iran, exploited the growing realism of AI voice technology. Research by Queen Mary University of London found that AI-generated voice clones are often indistinguishable from real human voices and are even rated as more trustworthy. Only former Inter Milan owner Massimo Moratti sent money, which was later frozen. Global losses from deepfake scams have surged to over $547 million between January and June 2025, with growing concerns about AI-generated content being used to create fake videos and sexually explicit material, including child abuse content. This has prompted legal actions, including a US federal law criminalizing AI-generated intimate images and Australia banning a deepfake generation app.
title: AI now sounds more like us – should we be concerned?
